verses.name: Romans 4:18
verses.text: Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations; according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.

verses.name: Romans 4:19
verses.text: And being not weak in faith, he considered not his own body now dead, when he was about an hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sara’s womb:

verses.name: Romans 4:20
verses.text: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;

verses.name: Romans 4:21
verses.text: And being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.

verses.name: Romans 4:22
verses.text: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.
